intro: Valeriana caespitosa, commonly known as clustered valerian, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers arranged in dense, rounded clusters at the tips of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a strong, aromatic scent. Valeriana caespitosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally for its calming effects.
